page.title: 18COMMUNICATION.
page.content: There are two post offices in this area one is in Hopton village and one in Doddington. They sell food and sweets for customers.But they also dispense pensions, family allowances and unemployment money. There is a post box by the old post office where letters are collected at 8.55am and 4.0pm on weekdays. At Doddington the post goes at 8.0am and 3.45pm. The post is delivered in the morning by Mrs Goode who walks on a round from Hopton to Doddington and Mr. Broome who cycles from Hopton to Cleeton St. Mary. Most families have a phone but there is a telephone kiosk in Hopton, Cleeton, Crumps Brook and Doddington. .
